description: An improvised rifle, handcrafted from scrap.  Normally, they were used for hunting and self defence.  Unlike normal marble guns which use alcohol as an ignition, this one use a pneumatic system.  Be careful where you reload it, pumping air into the tank takes a few seconds.  Pretty quiet, quite deadly, and it can use nails, marbles, and paintball as ammo.
An improvised rifle, handcrafted from scrap.  Slingshot is normally a toy, and does almost nothing against a zombie.  However, this one is modified and much better.  Easy to reload and powerful.

A plastic tube with a sliding handle that can be used to quickly load 10 rounds into a pump action paintball gun's tube in a much shorter period of time than by hand.  Somehow it also fits in a pump slingshot.
A double shot pistol that loads two 12 gauge shotgun shells, handcrafted from scrap.  You can fire it one by one, or you can fire both barrels at the same time.
A single shot pistol that loads 40mm grenades, handcrafted from scrap.  Pocket sized ka-boom it is!
A single shot pistol that loads .410 shells, handcrafted from scrap.
A double shot pistol that loads two .410 shells, handcrafted from scrap.  You can fire it one by one, or you can fire both barrels at the same time.
A crappy laser machine gun, made with duct tape, lots of circuts, a steel drum, and hope.
A crappy laser sniper rifle, made with duct tape, lots of circuts, a steel drum, and hope.
A beautifully decorated blunderbuss pistol.  Good old version of a 12 guage pistol.
A scrappy and bulky reproduction of the civil war era LeMat revolver, this one use the older paper cartridge ammo.  Despite modern quality materials, the design is still rather delicate.
The flintlock Lemat revolver is unique in that its cylinder axis pin is also a fully functional blunderbuss barrel.  It's irremovable.

name: flintlock blunderbuss
description: A mixture of a flintlock, and a blunderbuss, and can shoot both rounds... Gods, an abomination!  Who created this atrocity?

name: nock gun
description: A flintlock with seven barrels, so it is used as some kind of shotgun or a machine gun.  Very powerful, but takes a lot of time to fully reload.

name: 14 barrel nock gun
description: A flintlock with fourteen barrels, so it is used as some kind of shotgun or a machine gun.  Very powerful, but takes a lot of time to fully reload.  Due to it's weight and size, you only can mount this to shoot this.

name: flintlock shotgun
description: The modern shotgun's great grandpa.  Even back then, shooting with a shower of lead worked against evil.  Still works against the undead.

name: flintlock double-barrel shotgun
description: The modern shotgun's great grandpa.  Even back then, shooting with a shower of lead worked against evil.  Still works against the undead.  Twice the barrel, twice the fun.
A fairly harmless pistol that shoots small paintballs.
A fairly harmless revolver that shoots small paintballs.
A harmless revolver that shoots small paintballs.
A cheap copy of an old shotgun, possibly antique.  It is little more than a pair of barrels, a wood stock, and a hammer to strike the cartridges.
A cheap copy of an old shotgun, possibly antique.  It is little more than a barrel, a wood stock, a pump, and a hammer to strike the cartridges.
An expensive copy of a rifle.  Although it is used to shoot pepperballs, it could be also used for shooting paintballs.
An paintball smg.  Although it is used to shoot pepperballs, it could be also used for shooting paintballs.
An expensive copy of a light machine gun.  Although it is used to shoot pepperballs, it could be also used for shooting paintballs.
An expensive copy of a rifle.  It is used for shooting paintballs.
A six-foot wooden bow that takes a fair amount of strength to draw.  It can be used effectively by those of average strength.  Used mainly in medieval ages, as an ancient version of a slingshot.
A slow-loading hand weapon that launches three bolts.  Stronger people can reload it much faster.  Bolts fired from this weapon have a good chance of remaining intact for re-use.
A megaphone, which has been modified to make loud noises... and damage stuff?
This is a modified fire extinguisher, packed in its storage form.  Use it to pop it out and make it ready to fire.  Once it is activated, it cannot be repacked.

use_action.msg: You unpacked your fire extinguisher, ready to fire it if needed.

description: A fire extinguisher, which has been modified to make smoke cover... and damage stuff?
A fire extinguisher, which has been modified to make smoke cover... and damage stuff?
Made to spray some liquid, especially water, this thing is just a toy.  What did you expect?  You are not gonna use this... right?
Made to spray some water, this thing is not a toy, but a weapon.  It freezes your enemies.
A wooden sling bow, easy to use and accurate.  This one have some modification so that it can shoot arrows and bolts.
A modern slingshot with a wrist brace, it is easy to use, accurate, and quite powerful.  This one have some modification so that it can shoot arrows and bolts.
A tool used to drive nails into wood or other material.  It could also be used as an ad-hoc weapon.  This one is modified and can shoot nails in bursts.
This is a roman candle, packed in its storage form.  Use it to pop it out and make it ready to fire.  Once it is activated, it cannot be repacked.

use_action.msg: You unpacked your roman candle, ready to fire it if needed.

name: Roman candle
description: A Roman candle is a traditional type of firework that ejects one or more stars or exploding shells.  It is only usable once, so you have to throw this away after you empty the cartridge.
An improvised... rifle?  Well, you can use this as a long ranged weapon, but it is almost useless.  You have been warned.
An improvised... pistol?  Well, you can use this as a ranged weapon, but it is almost useless.  You have been warned.
A single shot pistol that loads discs.  Surprisingly, those discs does not just include normal frizbees, but more.
A single shot rifle that loads discs.  Surprisingly, those discs does not just include normal frizbees, but more.
A weird watch, which could be used for stunning people and zombies.  Works well with a indigo colored blazer and a bow tie.

A slow-loading hand weapon that launches bolts.  Stronger people can reload it much faster.  Bolts fired from this weapon have a good chance of remaining intact for re-use.  This one had been modified to give some extra heat damage.
A wooden blowgun, it isn't hard to use, and is very accurate.  Darts or bbs are used as ammunition.
A pen shaped laser gun, it isn't hard to use, and is very accurate.
A pen shaped laser gun, it isn't hard to use, and is very accurate but weak.
A pen shaped laser gun, it isn't hard to use, and is very accurate but weak.
A steel pen gun, it isn't hard to use, and is very accurate.  Darts are used as ammunition.  Do not expect a lot of damage.
A steel pen flamethrower, it isn't hard to use, and is very accurate.  Flammable liquid is used as ammunition.  Do not expect a lot of damage.
A steel pen chemical thrower, it isn't hard to use, and is very accurate.  Various types of liquid is used as ammunition.  Do not expect a lot of damage.
This red eye here isolates and measures the electronic impulses in your brains.  More specifically, the ones for sight.
A home-made shotgun.  It is simply a pipe attached to a stock, with a hammer to strike the single round it holds.  Easliy craftable, but easliy breakable.
A leather glove, easy to use and accurate.  It helps the user to throw rocks and pebbles as ammunition.

An improvised, huge, and direct launcher for rocks.  Essentially, two thick-walled steel pipes, equipped with two rubber bands.  Effective as giving a one-two punch from a pro boxer, but only at short to medium range, barely.

An improvised, huge, and direct launcher for rocks.  Essentially, eight thick-walled steel pipes, equipped with two rubber bands.  Effective as giving a one-two punch from a pro boxer, but only at short to medium range, barely.

name: rock sniper blaster
description: An improvised, huge, and direct launcher for rocks.  Essentially, two thick-walled steel pipes, equipped with two rubber bands.  Effective as giving a one-two punch from a pro boxer.  This launcher has significantly increased accuracy at the cost of taking even longer to reload.

name: rock launcher gauntlet
description: An improvised, huge, and direct launcher for rocks.  Essentially, two thick-walled steel pipes, equipped with two rubber bands, added to a gauntlet.  Effective as giving a one-two punch from a pro boxer.  This launcher has significantly shorter reload and much damaging, at the cost of a shorter range.
A large flamethrower with substantial gas reserves.  Very menacing and deadly.  This one is so big that needs to be mounted.

A modified version of the classic hand crossbow which utilizes marbles as projectiles instead of the traditional bolt.  Primarily intended for hunting small game, stronger people can reload it much faster.
The bolter, also called a boltgun, and its variants are some of the most powerful, hand-held, ballistic anti-personnel weaponry in use by the military forces.  This one is a rifle variant.
The bolter, also called a boltgun, and its variants are some of the most powerful, hand-held, ballistic anti-personnel weaponry in use by the military forces.  This one is a pistol variant.
A removable plastic magazine for the bolter.  Holds 80 rounds.
A removable plastic and compact magazine for the bolter.  Holds 30 rounds.

Disc shooting guns were a simple toy before cataclysm, and wasn't much of a danger, much less to call it a weapon.  However, some people did had some twisted intent and made the good ol' toy into a deadly, multi-targeting weapon.  It's heavy, but reliable for a hand-made weapon.
A large can, cut in almost half.  Holds up 50 rounds of discs.
A large pipe, makes bb guns reload faster.  Holds up 50 rounds of bbs.

This pistol is a series of customised Beretta 92Fs produced by a famous gunsmith called Joseph Kendo on behalf of the Kendo Gun Shop in Raccoon City.  The Samurai Edges were purpose-built for the Special Tactics and Rescue Service, and inspired later lines of modified Beretta 92s.  Accepts both 45 and 9mm.
A poor survivor's laser rifle.  Not good as a coperate made laser rifle, this weapon can still do the same to your foes.

A poor survivor's laser rifle.  Not good as a coperate made laser rifle, this weapon can still do the same to your foes.  This one also have a hand crank to charge a battery, but due to this, you can only reload certain type of batteries.

Boeing developed the focused plasma weaponry together with DARPA.  It heats solid hydrogen to create plasma and envelops it with polymers to reduce blooming.  While powerful, it suffers from short range.  Powered by UPS.  This one has been modified by a survivor to have some additonal feautures.
A weird plant, which looks like it came from an 80s movie.

hit_you_effect.message: Audrey injects a small amount of poison into your target.
Audrey injects a small amount of poison into your target.

description: This magazine can hold 300 BBs.
This magazine can hold 300 BBs.  Also modded so that it could self-eject when the last round is fired, for quick reload.
Popular among children.  More accurate than the original one, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.
Popular among children.  More accurate than the original one, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.
Popular among children.  More accurate than the original one, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.
Popular among kidults.  More accurate than the original one, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal tiny damage.
Popular among children.  More accurate than the original one, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.
A non-disintegrating cloth ammo belt which can hold up to 1200 BBs.  Notably less reliable than metal ammo belts.
Popular among children.  Good for plinking, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.
Popular among children.  Easliy hidable, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.
Popular among children.  Looking like a tommy gun, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.
Popular among children.  More accurate than the original one, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.  This one looks like a H&K MP5A4.
Popular among children.  More accurate than the original one, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.  This one looks like a M4.
Popular among children.  More accurate than the original one, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.  This one looks like an AR-10.
Popular among children.  More accurate than the original one, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.  This one looks like an AK-47.
Popular among children.  More accurate than the original one, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.  This one looks like a SCAR-H.
Popular among children.  More accurate than the original one, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.  This one looks like a M27 IAR.
The AMT Hardballer is a stainless steel clone of the Colt M1911A1 made by Arcadia Machine & Tool.  Reliable, almost like the original.

This is a Russian revolver shotgun fed by a 5-round swing-out cylinder.  It is produced by the TsKIB SOO, Central Design and Research Bureau of Sporting and Hunting Arms.  This revolver-shotgun hybrid packs some punch, and just as good as other shotguns.  Was used in Russia, but somehow it's in your hands now.
Shortened version of the MTs255 shotgun, this revolver-shotgun hybrid also packs some punch, just like the original.  Was used in Russia, but somehow it's in your hands now.
This net pistol was one of the first handheld web weapons.  It is larger than most traditional handguns, but displays no recoil whatsoever.
An umbrella, which is closed now. You can use this as an actual umbrella, if needed.

use_action.msg: You opened your umbrella, ready to shield yourself from rain.

description: An umbrella, which is opened now. You can use this as an improvised weapon, if needed.

use_action.msg: You closed your umbrella, ready to use it as a shotgun.

description: An umbrella, which is closed and activated its internal shotgun mod.  You can use this as an actual cane or an actual umbrella, if needed.

use_action.msg: You closed your umbrella, ready to use it as a bashing weapon.

description: This cane is an ingenious combination of elegance and stealthy firepower.  Designed to appear as a classic, but fancy, walking cane, this versatile piece of equipment conceals a powerful shotgun within its finely crafted wooden shaft.
An one-shot, pneumatic airbow handcrafted from scrap.  Be careful where you reload it, pumping air into the tank takes a few seconds.  It is quiet and deadly.
This is a type of blaster that was a standard-issue handgun for the New England Police Department Blob Ruinner Unit.  Looks like it was constructed from parts of a revolver and a rifle.
A .223 revolver, custom made.  This is a one-of-a-kind firearm, obviously made with love and skill.

This is a rare, custom-made weapon that shoots steel rails at such a high velocity, they can sever body parts and pin them to walls.  The hypervelocity metal stake that it fires is accelerated to the point of spontaneous combustion by a Lorentz force generated by electromagnetic induction, powered by a standard UPS.

name: jezail rifle
description: This is a simple, cost-efficient and often handmade long arm commonly used in South Asia and parts of the Middle East in the past.  It was popular amongst the Pashtun tribesmen, who deposed Shah Shuja.
A break-action single-shot pistol which was introduced in 1967 by Thompson/Center Arms.  It can be chambered in various cartridges.

As the descendant and the better reproduction of Medusa Model 47, this revolver is specially made for most types of ammunition.  Due to some up-to-date tech, there are no problems in order to load and shoot various types of ammo.
A mysterious revolver.

A custom-made crossbow with a clever mechanism that loads and fires pebbles in a single motion, it has a wooden magazine that holds 10 pebbles.  Pebbles fired from this weapon have a good chance of remaining intact for re-use.

A custom-made crossbow with a clever mechanism that loads and fires nails in a single motion, it has a wooden magazine that holds 10 nails.  Nails fired from this weapon have a good chance of remaining intact for re-use.

A small concealable pistol-like crossbow.  It's weak due to its small size and draw, so it is best suited for hunting small game.  Nails fired from this weapon have a good chance of remaining intact for re-use.
A slow-loading hand weapon that launches nails.  Stronger people can reload it much faster.  Nails fired from this weapon have a good chance of remaining intact for re-use.
A beautifully decorated pistol sword.  Impractical, yet somebody always wanted to have these type of item.
A combination knife and revolver that acts as both a lethal melee weapon and a pistol.

A self-made chemical sprayer, this modified spray can is probably as dangerous to the user as anyone else.  The nozzle has been crudely modified to disperse chemicals, and a small pump attached to the side allows for repressurization, though this process takes a few minutes.

A favorite of hooligans around the world, this lighter duct-taped to a spray can is probably as dangerous to the user as anyone else.  The nozzle has been crudely modified to disperse gasoline, and a small pump attached to the side allows for repressurization, though this process takes a few minutes.
Adapted for combat on land, this explosive harpoon can be fired short distances and deals tremendous damage on direct impact.  Could reload pebble-type ammo for versatility.
A Breech-loading, single shot handgun designed to fire the .50 BMG cartridge.  Reconstruct the word "Hand Cannon".

A semi-automatic bullpup sniper rifle.  Only 176 were built due to its high manufacturing cost, making it one of the rarest and most sought production firearms ever made.  

640509-040147
Standard 6-round box magazine for a Walther 2000 sniper rifle.

//: The name means noiseless. At least that's what the translator told me.
description: A tihar's bigger brother, handcrafted from scrap.  Be careful where you reload it, pumping air into the tank takes a few seconds.  It is pretty quiet and quite deadly.
A single shot pistol gauntlet that loads 12 gauge shotgun shells, handcrafted from scrap.
A flamethrower gauntlet that loads gasoline, handcrafted from scrap.
A toy gun, which uses air pressure to fire a small tethered or untethered projectile out of a barrel, most often via piston action though sometimes via spring pressure.
A toy gun, which uses air pressure to fire a small tethered or untethered projectile out of a barrel, most often via piston action though sometimes via spring pressure.

A toy gun, which uses air pressure to fire a small tethered or untethered projectile out of a barrel, most often via piston action though sometimes via spring pressure.  This one can hit multiple targets.

//: The name means silence. At least that's what the translator told me.
description: A multistroke pneumatic pistol handcrafted from scrap.  Be careful where you reload it, pumping air into the tank takes a few seconds.  It is pretty quiet and quite deadly.
A multistroke pneumatic pistol for shooting competitons.  Be careful where you reload it, pumping air into the tank takes a few seconds.  Very quiet and quite deadly.
This is a cheap shock rifle made from a tazer and some common components.
The Mauser C96, or broomhandle, is a semi-automatic pistol that was originally produced by Germany.  It was pretty good, but it was the unique shape that kept the gun famous untill now.
This ammo clip can hold 10 rounds of 7.62x25mm and quickly reload a Mauser C96.
Popular among kidults.  Much more accurate than the original one, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.  Custom-made for a guy has some taste.
The successor to the semi-known AK-74 rifle.  It combines the reliability of the AK series and the short length with the high-velocity.
A noise weapon, which has been modified to make loud noises... and damage stuff greatly?
A bow made from multiple materials for increased energy efficiency.  A variation of the composite bow, made in Korea.  Complicated to make, but stronger than an all-wood short bow.

A slow-loading hand weapon that launches bolts.  Stronger people can reload it much faster.  Bolts fired from this weapon have a good chance of remaining intact for re-use.  Modified from an AR-15, this crossbow is bit faster to reload.
A bullpup pump-action shotgun, the DP-12 has two barrels and two magazine tubes.  Unlike the KSG this cannot change the ammo during shooting, but can shoot twice at one trigger pull.
This rifle is the first AR chambered in 4.6x30mm, and also the first 4.6x30mm firearm ever released to the U.S. civilian market.  Good for home defence.
//: Just a rifle for a 4.6 caliber

description: This rifle is chambered in 5.7x28mm, usable as a rifle.  Good for home defence.  20 rounds, but could be used as your average ARs.
//: Just a rifle for a 5.7 caliber

description: This rifle is chambered in 5.7x28mm, usable as a rifle with the P90 mag.  Good for home defence.  Bit weird to reload, but hey, 50 rounds is 50 rounds, right?
//: Just a rifle for a 5.7 caliber

description: Short for Universal Combat Pistol, that was developed as a competitor of FN Five-Seven.  Only accepts small magazines.
//: Just a pistol for a 4.6 caliber - didn't we have this before?

description: The Agram 2000 is a Croatian submachine gun inspired by Beretta's model M12.  It does have the unique thumbhole foregrip.
A standard 32-round steel box magazine for use with the agram 2000 SMG.

Designed to work with FN's proprietary 5.7x28mm round, the Kel-Tec P50 is a bit large pistol with unique shape, unique reloading system, and a very high capacity, so it is best used against armored opponents.  Accepts FN P90's magazines.
SVD is one of the first semi-automatic designated marksman rifle chambered in the 7.6254mmR cartridge, developed in the Soviet Union.
A 15 round box magazine for the SVD rifle.
The Mossberg 500 is a popular series of pump-action shotguns, often acquired for military use.  Now shortened, this large-pistol sized gun is perfect for sidearms.
A revolver produced by Italian manufacturer Chiappa Firearms.  Its most distinctive feature is that the barrel is on a much lower bore axis.
Designed to engage various targets at a range up to a kilometer, this sniper rifle is well made and deadly.
A compact 10-round magazine for SV-98 rifles, made of stamped sheet metal.
This is a 7.62x39mm light machine gun developed in the Soviet Union.  Just like the AKM, this gun is also renowned for its durability even under the worst conditions.
A bulky 100-round drum magazine for 7.62x39 RPD light machine gun, made of stamped sheet metal.
This is a 7.62x39mm light machine gun developed in the Soviet Union.  This gun is also renowned for its durability, wide uses, and a fictional special operator who uses this.
A bulky 47-round drum magazine for 7.62x54mmR DP-28 light machine gun, made of stamped sheet metal.
A pistol perfect for backpacking, camping and range day plinking.
A standard capacity magazine for the PMR-30 pistol.
A pistol which used some parts of M9, this burst-fire machine pistol is one of the most scucessful machine pistols in history.
A small derringer pistol bearing a slight resemblance to the Mossberg Brownie.  Somehow, it could kill your enemy in one shot.  A perfect weapon for an assassin.
A pistol made for use by artillery and mortar crews, tank crews and aircraft personnel.  Uses 9x18mm ammo.
A standard capacity magazine for the Stechkin APS pistol.

The Berdan is a single-shot rifle created by American engineer and inventor Hiram Berdan in 1868.  The gun was widely used in Russia as a hunting weapon, a combat rifle, and were used until the mid-1930s.
Sawn-off version of a Mosin-Nagant rifle.  Could be used as a pistol.  A big one, but a pistol nonetheless.
Not as famous as the Desert Eagle, but this firearm is also famous as 'No. 2 of the heavy handguns.'  Is visible from various games, movies, and anime.
A standard 6-round steel box magazine for use with the AMT AutoMag.
A plastic single shot pistol, modified from a flaregun, that can be loaded with acids.
Made by Diamondback Firearms, this OA-98 looking handgun is big but quite useful.
A sawn-off elephant gun.  Just like obrezs or Luparas, this is also a pistol version of the rifle version.  Used for self defence, and could be still used for self defence.
A custom-made rifle specially designed for the hunting of huge game called tanks.  You could obviously kill everything with this, EVERYTHING.  If you ever find enough ammo of course.
The R9-ARMS is a gun with a lot of mysteries.  Nobody knows where it was made and how many people are using it.
A popular carbine, long used by the US sheriffs.  Though accurate, small, and lightweight, it is infamous for its unreliability when not properly maintained.

One of the most recognizable assault rifles ever made, the AKM is renowned for its durability even under the worst conditions.  This one's origin is unknown, but who cares, this is a great defence weapon in the apocalypse.
A single shot pistol made from 1874 Sharps rifle.
A lacrosse stick, or crosse is used to play the sport of lacrosse.  Facing armageddon, you could use this to throw rocks.
A single shot pistol that loads .22 LR cartridges, and could be also used as a smoking pipe.  Somehow much more damaging than other .22 firearms, but lacks range.
Known for it's unique rotary magazine, this rifle was used by US Marines as an alternative of a Garand.
A tiny piece of grooved metal designed to allow a shooter to quickly load a bolt-action rifle.
A weapon developed in Israel.  Unlike the original, this one have two barrels, thus doubling the fun.
A high-capacity 60-round casket magazine for use with Gilboa Snake rifles.
Ol' shotgun on steroids, this cerberus of shot will make anything into a hamburger meat.

A single barrel shotgun with an external magazine and reloading device, a.k.a "alamo system."  Holds up to five shells at a time, including the one in the chamber.  Due to the unique system, it needs longer time to reload.
Israeli-made rifle, the Galil works well in worst conditions, at the cost of it's heavy weight.
A hand puppet, which looks like a mafia with a tommy gun in it's hands.  Somehow you could fire the tiny tommy gun that the doll has.
A Korean revolver, which was for the police.  This civilian model excludes it's unique smart module.
A seven-round revolver made in soviet union.  Also known for the usage of suppressor on a revolver, thanks to it's unique mechanism.
Based on the AR-15, the KAC SR-47 is chambered for ammo that is used for an AKM.
A single shot pistol that loads .308 Winchester.
This 7.5" barreled Uberti Cattleman was modified to hold an ammo belt, not a cylinder.  However, the reload mechanism is still the same, so the user have to reload the bullets one by one.

This 7.5" barreled Uberti Cattleman was modified to have a special ammo effect, which makes the user to hit multiple targets at once at the cost of shorter range.  
"You're Pretty Good."
The M231 Firing Port Weapon (FPW) is an adapted version of the M16 assault rifle for shooting from firing ports on tanks.  It's unique shape makes the handling of the gun quite difficult.
The world must be made whole again.  In Memory of a Patriot, Who Saved the World.

A highly accurate and modular assault rifle specially designed for the United States Special Operations Command.  The 'L' in its name stands for light, as it uses the lightweight 5.56x45mm round.  This model features a shorter barrel and a side folding stock for vehicle or aircraft crew use.

A highly accurate and modular battle rifle specially designed for the United States Special Operations Command.  The 'H' in its name stands for heavy, as it uses the powerful 7.62x51mm (.308) round.  This model features a shorter barrel and a side folding stock for vehicle or aircraft crew use.
The SRM Arms Model 1216 is a semi-automatic shotgun with a 16-round detachable revolver magazine.  Designed for mobility, it is light and short and intended for home defense and law enforcement.
A removable plastic magazine for the SRM Arms Model 1216 shotgun.  Holds 16 rounds.
A prototype American repeating rifle, recreated and rechambered for some .44 ammo.  Unreliable but powerful.
It's weird, but it works.

The Trailmaster is a sleek and reliable lever-action rifle designed for hunting and sport shooting.  It features a polished wooden stock, smooth cycling action, and a durable stainless steel barrel.  Ideal for both seasoned marksmen and outdoor enthusiasts.

This ubiquitous rifle is a cousin of the AR-15 rifle series.  It is lightweight and accurate, but will malfunction if not properly maintained.  This one is a semi-automatic civilian version, and accepts desert eagle magazines.

A break action firearm comprised of two 5.56x45mm barrels over a 12 gauge smooth bore barrel.  Recreated and remade by modern firearm companies, now used by their egomaniac descendants in New England.
The integrated underbarrel shotgun of a drilling rifle which holds a shot.  It's irremovable.
A home-made rifle.  It is simply a pipe attached to a stock, with a hammer to strike the single round it holds.
Double-barreled break-action rifle loaded with two .308 WIN rounds.
Based on the G80 railgun, this was a modification of an average G36 rifle to be made as a railgun-assault rifle.  With enough energy source, you have one hell of a powerful rifle.
The SIG MPX was made by by SIG Sauer, and this could be used as a .40 caliber version of the classic MP5.  It was, before they stopped producing this model.
A standard capacity curved magazine for use with the SIG MPX SMG.
A drum magazine for use with the SIG MPX SMG.  Much greater capacity but less reliable the factory specification magazine.
This is a heavily modified fully automatic Russian service rifle with an increased internal magazine round of 15.
The PP-19 was developed for counter-terrorist and law enforcement units.  They did not like how the magazine worked.
A 64-round helical magazine for use with the PP-19 SMG.  Big capacity of ammo but pretty large and a bit unreliable.
A reliable and rugged lever-action rifle chambered in .454 Casull, perfect for hunting and sport shooting.  Designed with a smooth cycling action and durable hardwood stock for classic performance.
A dart gun is an air pistol that fires a dart.  It could also be used as an ad-hoc weapon.  Due to it's special mechanism, it can stun a target.
A small flamethrower with substantial gas reserves.  Not that menacing and deadly, but still good for burning things up.

name: flintlock spear
description: Also called a fire spear, this spear can shoot flintlock ammo and could be used as a spear at the same time.

//: Made to test rare ammo-using guns which also uses ups.

description: A 1911 made to accept and use the .357 ammo.  Bit unreliable compared to the original, but still pretty good to use.
An extended 10-round magazine for use with the Coonan handgun.
A military issue 7-round magazine for use with the Coonan handgun.
Modified 1911, which shoots .45 bullet in full auto.  Also have a built-in foregrip.

name.str: A Light Shining In the Darkness

description: ,        "And the light shineth in darkness and the darkness comprehended it not."
A gun that uses atomic energy, like a dragon's breath.  Good for mowing your enemies.
A gun that uses atomic energy, as a dragon's breath shotgun.  It is overheated, so you need to wait for a moment for it to cool down.

use_action.msg: You pull the activating lever, readying the meltagun to fire.
use_action.not_ready_msg: You need to wait a bit longer.

description: Modified Makarov PM, which shoots 9x18mm cartridge in full auto.  Also have a built-in foregrip.
A high-capacity drum magazine for the RARAN Prototype 1130, modified from PPSh-41 drum magazine.
A crystal skull, which shoots projectiles.
A small pistol caliber carbine designed for military use, the Mx4 Storm uses magazines that are interchangeable with other Beretta 9x19mm handguns.
A M1911 that loads and shoots metal rails, for special operators during special missions.
Somewhat similar to the AR-10, is intended to replace the M24.  Also known as KAC SR-25, this rifle is used in the army.
An old shotgun, possibly antique.  It is little more than a pair of barrels, a wood stock, and a hammer to strike the .62 caliber or 20 gauge cartridges.
10mm AR platform PDW, customized to offer Full-Automatic fire.  This can use Glock 20 magazines.
The M26 MASS V2 is a semi-automatic shotgun based on the first version.  This one is with a stock, making it available for the user to use it as a standalone.
Modified underbarrel flare launcher, with a stock at the back of the launcher.  Since there is a stock attached, you can shoot the flare more accurate... if that is useful.

The Aeroknox XM556 is a (relatively) lightweight M134 minigun.  Its six barrels are rotated by an electric motor, powered by UPS or vehicle.  If you could find enough ammo for it, it would become a devastating weapon.

//: SMGs aren't as commercially traded as rifles/handguns/SGs, so no cite for price points.  Total weight of gun 3500 grams.  Current weight of folding stock 200 grams.
description: The Socimi 38 was an abomination of an uzi and Socimi Type 821.  It a 38 caliber, uzi-lookalike SMG.
A standard 32-round steel box magazine for use with the Socimi 38 SMG.

//: SMGs aren't as commercially traded as rifles/handguns/SGs, so no cite for price points.  Total weight of gun 3500 grams.  Current weight of folding stock 200 grams.
description: The Walther MP was a prototype for an anti-terrorist operation, which failed.  But this was reproduced to fit a newer caliber, for a new generation.
A standard 32-round steel box magazine for use with the Walther .357sig MP.
One of the most recognizable assault rifles ever made, the AKM is renowned for its durability even under the worst conditions.  This one is plated with gold.
The AR-38 Super is a AR-15 variant chambered in .38 Super, built for speed and accuracy.  It features a tuned gas system and match barrel for low recoil and fast follow-up shots.
A magazine for AR-38 Super, made of stamped sheet metal.
A compact SMG chambered in .38 Super, built for speed and tight control in close quarters.
A standard 20-round mag, curved for smooth .38 Super feeding.  Durable and fast to reload.

name: chaff launcher
description: A bigger flare gun, this can shoot several signal flares at once.
A wooden spear thrower, which is more like an arrow/bolt thrower, easy to use and accurate.  It uses arrows or bolts as ammunition.
//: Gets more damage and range based on throwing skill and strength

description: Developed as a lower-cost successor to H&K's own MP5, the Universal Machine Pistol is a closed-bolt, simple blowback sub-machine gun constructed of lightweight polymer.  In order to make it more attractive to American police departments, it was offered in .40 S&W and .45 ACP as well as the ubiquitous 9x19mm.  This version is chambered in .40 S&W.
A straight, double-stack plastic box magazine for the UMP sub-machine gun in .40 S&W.  Holds 30 rounds.
An improvised 20-round straight single-stack box magazine consisting of little more than a bent sheet of steel held together by duct tape and hope, for use with the UMP40 SMG.

A compact, blowback-operated semi-full automatic rifle chambered in .32 ACP, designed for discreet urban defense and civilian training. Its slim profile and 40-round magazine make it ideal for close-quarters maneuverability.
A straight, double-stack plastic box magazine for the Vektorline S-32 sub-machine gun in .32 ACP.  Holds 40 rounds.
A brother of the old COP .357 derringer, this model uses .410 shotshells as it's ammunition.  Good for finishing a job.

The S&W 1917-R46 is a lightweight classic revolver rifle chambered in modern 4.6x30mm, combining compact carbine range with revolver simplicity.  Its six-shot rotary cylinder delivers precision with minimal recoil.

The S&W 1917-M46 is the compact revolver counterpart to the S&W 1917-R46 rifle, both chambered in 4.6x30mm.  With a reinforced frame and extended cylinder, it brings the rifles precision and punch to a sidearm format.

The S&W 1917-R57 is a lightweight classic revolver rifle chambered in modern 5.7x28mm, combining compact carbine range with revolver simplicity.  Its six-shot rotary cylinder delivers precision with minimal recoil.

The S&W 1917-M57 is the compact revolver counterpart to the S&W 1917-R57 rifle, both chambered in 5.7x28mm.  With a reinforced frame and extended cylinder, it brings the rifles precision and punch to a sidearm format.
This is a scrappy laser rifle made from common components.  Weak, but can be powered with UPS.
This is a scrappy laser pistol made from common components.  Weak, but can be powered with UPS.
Unlike the previous model, this Canik TP454 is huge, but gives a stable recoil for a .454 round pistol.  A hand cannon suits for the apocalypse.
A standard 8-round steel box magazine for use with the Canik TP454.

The Springfield XD-45C is a heavy variant of the XD line, chambered in classic .45 Colt for a blend of old-world stopping power and modern ergonomics.  Its polymer frame tames recoil while preserving the rounds heavy impact.  A fusion of tradition and tactical reliability, it stands out as a unique sidearm choice.
A standard 8-round steel box magazine for use with the Springfield Xd 45C.
An Iraqi semi-automatic designated marksman rifle, made from a modified version of the Zastava M76 sniper rifle.  Accepts the same ammo and the magazine that the famous AKM uses.
A 20 round double stack box magazine for the Tabuk rifle.
Yes, it is a pistol made out of scraps.  And yes, it shoots modified mininukes.  Just watch out for it's explosive range.
A device used for the stunning of animals prior to slaughter.  Goes well with a mushroom-like bob hairstyle and a suppressed shotgun.
A variation of UNZ-12 shotgun, this rifle accepts and shoots .500 magnum rounds.  Good for giving a lot of damage.
A 20 round single stack box magazine for the UNZ-500 rifle.
An electrolaser developed by the R&D outfit "Aerial Labs", in case the drones went haywire.  Especially effective against electronic targets.
The H&K 51B is a H&K G3 modified by Vollmer Arms, which is an abomination between a MP5, G3, and a light machine gun.  And this is a sub-machine gun.
The Calico M950 is an automatic pistol with a unique circular magazine that allows for high capacities and reduced recoil.
The PP-19-01 Vityaz is a Russian submachine gun/pistol caliber carbine from the 1950s, chambered in 9x18mm Makarov.
A standard 30-round magazine for the PP-19-01 Vityaz, in 9x18mm Makarov.
A single shot pistol that loads 12 gauge shotgun shells.  Handy sidearm in the apocalypse.
A revolver modified to accept shotgun ammo, it can hold 3 cartridges.
A radio, which can give off a radio wave to a certain area for a loud bombardment.  For some reason, the people on the other side of the walkie-talkie don't seem to care whoever you are.
The Ithaca Deerslayer is a slug gun which is designed for long range while using a shotshell.  Unlike an average shotgun, this model have a rifled barrel.
The A-Bolt is a bolt-action slug gun which loads and shoots .410 caliber shotshells.  Was used for hunting animals, and can be used for hunting undead.
The Taurus Lightning is a 5-shot revolver chambered in .308.  It has impressive stopping power.
The Taurus Dragoon is a 5-shot revolver chambered in 7.62x39mm and 7.62x54mm.  It has impressive stopping power.
A single shot pistol that loads 20x66mm shotgun shells.  Handy sidearm in the apocalypse.
Considered overkill by many, the Taurus 550 samaritan remains an ultimate powerful sidearm to the arsenal of anybody.
A police weapon designed and developed in Russia.  Accepts 9x18mm cartridges.

A bullpup pump-action shotgun, the S&W M&P 410 uses a pair of magazine tubes to increase its capacity.  Each tube has to be loaded separately, but this offers the option of loading different ammunition for different situations.  An integral top rail is provided for mounting sights, without which it will perform poorly.
The integrated second shotgun magazine of the S&W M&P 410 which holds 7 shots.  It's irremovable.

An improvised, direct ignition launcher for home-made rockets.  Essentially, two thick-walled steel pipes, equipped with a pilot light each, several batteries and a simple circuit board.  Effective only at medium range, barely.

An improvised, direct ignition launcher for home-made rockets.  Essentially, four thick-walled steel pipes, equipped with a pilot light each, several batteries and a simple circuit board.  Effective only at medium range, barely.
This is a long-barreled variant of the Uberti Cattleman, also with a stock.  Fast is fine, but accuracy is final.
Compact pump action shotgun with close range stopping power.  Favored by French special operators.  This one is chambered in .410 bore.

A double-shot break-action shotgun, chambered in .410 bore.  Designed as a lower-recoil alternative to 12 gauge shotguns, it is light and easy to manufacture.  This one have two barrels, increasing the weight but also the firepower.

A HUGE ancient crossbow from ancient Greece with a very slow, difficult reloading process not suited for unskilled users.  Normal crossbow bolts will not fit - fishing spears only.  Its tension is so powerful that you feel it shake after firing.  Fishing spears fired from this weapon have a good chance of remaining intact for re-use.  Needs to be mounted in order to fire.

The Vepr-12 is a semi-automatic/full-automatic shotgun designed by Molot as a competitor to the Saiga-12.  It reloads with a magazine, rather than one shell at a time like most shotguns.  Just like it's competitor, this shotgun is also used as a law-enforcement usage.
A flaregun which bounces off from and to several enemies.
A flaregun which blows up when shot, damaging several enemies.
A flaregun which could charge up by absorbing fires and heat nearby, then making them as an ammo.
A flaregun which hits enemies harder than an average one.
A flaregun which shoots bursts of ammo, and igniting them.
Made to spray some acid, this thing is not a toy, but a weapon.  It melts your enemies.
Made to spray some chemical gas, this thing is not a toy, but a weapon.  It affects your enemies in various ways.
Made to spray some acid, this thing is not a toy, but a weapon.  It melts your enemies.
Made to spray some chemical gas, this thing is not a toy, but a weapon.  It affects your enemies in various ways.
A rugged, pump-action shotgun built for close-quarters survival.  Its short barrel and wide spread make it devastating against swarming threats, though accuracy drops sharply at range.

A reinforced pump-action shotgun fitted with an extended magazine tube, allowing far more shells to be carried before reloading.  Heavier and bulkier than standard models, it demands strength to handle effectively, but rewards the user with sustained firepower in prolonged fights.
A short, lightweight pump shotgun designed for quick handling and fast response.  Its reduced size makes it easy to carry alongside heavier weapons, ready to be brought up in an instant.

A compact shotgun fitted with a wide, drum magazine that allows for rapid loading one shell at a time.  Its design favors quick reflexes over steady aim, encouraging snap shots in chaotic close-quarters encounters.
A compact, twin-barreled lever-action shotgun designed for speed and mobility.  It sacrifices long-range precision for rapid follow-up shots and a brutal spread up close.

A rugged, double-barreled shotgun cut down for speed and raw impact.  Each trigger pull unleashes a fierce blast with enough recoil to stagger the unprepared, but in capable hands it can shove back threats as well as shred them.

A lightweight, double-barreled shotgun with a stripped-down frame and fast cycling action, with a cylinder below it's barrels.  Its design emphasizes speed over durability, letting the user fire and fall safe on higher places.

A compact, lever action shotgun with a sleek frame and shortened barrel, clearly designed for mobility.  Its lighter construction makes it easy to carry and fire on the move, but the reduced weight comes at the cost of stability and range.

A sawed-off, lever action shotgun with a double drum magazine designed for ambushes and close-range encounters.  Its short barrels and narrow sight make it unwieldy at a distance, but up close it delivers devastating, wide-spread bursts.
A compact shotgun derringer built for speed and quick handling.  Its short barrel favors mobility over long-range accuracy, allowing rapid follow-up shots in tight spaces.
A reinforced, mid-range shotgun equipped with a custom parts for carrying and retrieving supplies.  Easy to stun enemies, and also gives an ability to shock enemies with a melee strike.

A sleek, lever-action shotgun fitted with a reinforced stock and an integrated thick tubular magazine which cannot be unloaded.  The gun recovers it's ammo, encouraging aggressive close-range tactics.

A rugged, old-fashioned pump shotgun with a reinforced barrel and short tubular magazine.  Its design rewards careful timing, delivering powerful shots that hit harder after observing(or not) the fall of nearby threats.

A heavy, experimental shotgun fitted with an insulated frame and specialized chambering to handle volatile shells.  When fired, it releases intense bursts of heat alongside its payload, scorching targets at close range.

A hybrid weapon that merges a pump-action shotgun with a heavy axe head fixed to the barrel.  It offers brutal versatility in close combat, able to blast foes at point-blank range or cleave through them with a swing.

A bizarre, jury-rigged shotgun modified with pressurized canisters and a spray mechanism.  Instead of relying purely on shells, it can unleash bursts of messy, stinging payloads that disorient more than destroy.

A sinister-looking shotgun retrofitted with reinforced tubing and a corrosive reservoir.  Each shell discharges a volatile mix of shot and pressurized acid, eating through flesh, fabric, and even light armor on impact.

A modified S&W 629, AAI Quiet Special Purpose Revolver, is a rare variant.  This was used in the Vietnam war, for the "Tunnel Rat" branch.  Gives off more damage than an average revolver, but have a shorter range due to it's barrel has been sawn-off.
A rifle shaped laser gun, it isn't hard to use, and is very accurate but weak.
A submachine gun shaped laser gun, it isn't hard to use, and is very accurate but weak.
A pistol shaped laser gun, it isn't hard to use, and is very accurate but weak.

A single barreled machine shotgun, fed from handmade cloth belts.  Even properly mounted, this seems like a deadly beast, and the barrel make for difficult zeroing.  The externally driven action means this is much less likely to jam.

The Micro Dynamic .500 is a bullpup submachine gun built around the massive .500 cartridge, compressing raw power into a compact frame.  Its rear-set action keeps the weapon short and controllable despite the caliber.  Designed as a shock weapon, it delivers overwhelming force in close quarters.
A standard 32-round steel box magazine for use with the Micro Dynamic .500 SMG.

The Titan SMG-44 is a brute-force submachine gun chambered in .44, pushing the limits of close-range firepower. Compact yet devastating, it delivers heavy rounds in rapid succession.  Built for breaching and suppression, it turns confined spaces into battlegrounds.
A factory issue translucent polymer box magazine that fits with the frame of the Titan SMG-44.

A state-of-the-art laser rifle developed by the R&D outfit "Aerial Labs".  Initial performance rivaled Rivtech's finest, with rumors flying about corporate skulduggery.  Though the Cataclysm put that on the ash heap of history, this weapon can still do the same to your foes.
A pen shaped laser gun, it isn't hard to use, and is very accurate.  Now bound with several duct tapes and stuff, this now looks like a knock-off minigun.
This shotgun was made using a 3D printer, resulting in a very lightweight weapon.
This sniper rifle was made using a 3D printer, resulting in a very lightweight weapon.
This revolver was made using a 3D printer, resulting in a very lightweight weapon.

An electrically propelled steel rail launcher handcrafted from scrap.  The hypervelocity metal stake that it fires is accelerated to the point of spontaneous combustion by a Lorentz force generated by electromagnetic induction, powered by a standard UPS.

A muzzleloading blackpowder cannon made from logs bored for 3-inch shells, reinforced with iron bands.  While much lighter and easier to produce, it's not as effective and less durable than the real deal.  It is portable, just like your bottom.

A Luty pattern makeshift smoothbore LMG crudely constructed out of various steel parts using some of the more advanced powered hand tools; likely one of the most complex guns that are feasible to make outside of a machine shop, but still very unreliable.  This one is chambered for .308 ammo belts.

A Luty pattern makeshift smoothbore LMG crudely constructed out of various steel parts using some of the more advanced powered hand tools; likely one of the most complex guns that are feasible to make outside of a machine shop, but still very unreliable.  This one is chambered for .223 ammo belts.
A bolt-action rifle using .45 ACP rounds.  It is compatible with 1911 magazines.
